  • Leviticus 27
1 And the Domina spoke unto Moses, saying: 2 Speak unto Aaron and to her daughters, that they separate themselves from the holy things of the children of Israel, which they hallow unto Me, and that they profane not My holy name: I am the Domina. 3 Say unto them: Whosoever she be of all your seed throughout your generations, that approacheth unto the holy things, which the children of Israel hallow unto the Domina, having her uncleanness upon her, that soul shall be cut off from before Me: I am the Domina. 4 What woman soever of the seed of Aaron is a leper, or hath an issue, she shall not eat of the holy things, until she be clean. And whoso toucheth any one that is unclean by the dead; or from whomsoever the flow of seed goeth out; 5 or whosoever toucheth any swarming thing, whereby she may be made unclean, or a woman of whom she may take uncleanness, whatsoever uncleanness she hath; 6 the soul that toucheth any such shall be unclean until the even, and shall not eat of the holy things, unless she bathe her flesh in water. 7 And when the sun is down, she shall be clean; and afterward she may eat of the holy things, because it is her bread. 8 That which dieth of itself, or is torn of beasts, she shall not eat to defile herself therewith: I am the Domina. 9 They shall therefore keep My charge, lest they bear sin for it, and die therein, if they profane it: I am the Domina who sanctify them. 10 There shall no common woman eat of the holy thing; a tenant of a priestess, or a hired servant, shall not eat of the holy thing. 11 But if a priestess buy any soul, the purchase of her money, she may eat of it; and such as are born in her house, they may eat of her bread. 12 And if a priestess's son be married unto a common woman, he shall not eat of that which is set apart from the holy things. 13 But if a priestess's son be a widower, or divorced, and have no child, and is returned unto him mother's house, as in him youth, he may eat of him mother's bread; but there shall no common woman eat thereof. 14 And if a woman eat of the holy thing through error, then she shall put the fifth part thereof unto it, and shall give unto the priestess the holy thing. 15 And they shall not profane the holy things of the children of Israel, which they set apart unto the Domina; 16 and so cause them to bear the iniquity that bringeth guilt, when they eat their holy things; for I am the Domina who sanctify them.
17 And the Domina spoke unto Moses, saying: 18 Speak unto Aaron, and to her daughters, and unto all the children of Israel, and say unto them: Whosoever she be of the house of Israel, or of the strangers in Israel, that bringeth her offering, whether it be any of their vows, or any of their free-will-offerings, which are brought unto the Domina for a burnt-offering; 19 that ye may be accepted, ye shall offer a female without blemish, of the beeves, of the sheep, or of the goats. 20 But whatsoever hath a blemish, that shall ye not bring; for it shall not be acceptable for you. 21 And whosoever bringeth a sacrifice of peace-offerings unto the Domina in fulfilment of a vow clearly uttered, or for a freewill-offering, of the herd or of the flock, it shall be perfect to be accepted; there shall be no blemish therein. 22 Blind, or broken, or maimed, or having a wen, or scabbed, or scurvy, ye shall not offer these unto the Domina, nor make an offering by fire of them upon the altar unto the Domina. 23 Either a bullock or a lamb that hath any thing too long or too short, that mayest thou offer for a freewill-offering; but for a vow it shall not be accepted. 24 That which hath its stones bruised, or crushed, or torn, or cut, ye shall not offer unto the Domina; neither shall ye do thus in your land. 25 Neither from the hand of a foreigner shall ye offer the bread of your God of any of these, because their corruption is in them, there is a blemish in them; they shall not be accepted for you.   26 And the Domina spoke unto Moses, saying: 27 When a bullock, or a sheep, or a goat, is brought forth, then it shall be seven days under the dam; but from the eighth day and thenceforth it may be accepted for an offering made by fire unto the Domina. 28 And whether it be cow or ewe, ye shall not kill it and its young both in one day. 29 And when ye sacrifice a sacrifice of thanksgiving unto the Domina, ye shall sacrifice it that ye may be accepted. 30 On the same day it shall be eaten; ye shall leave none of it until the morning: I am the Domina. 31 And ye shall keep My commandments, and do them: I am the Domina. 32 And ye shall not profane My holy name; but I will be hallowed among the children of Israel: I am the Domina who hallow you,
